speaker: Navaa
text: So if you can just tell us a bit about yourself, name, age, what you do, what like your hobbies are, how you use Canva, sure.

text: Hi, my name is Jane. I'm a senior at UCLA, studying polysign econ in my free time, I like to do yoga. Shop go, you know, look at different cafes in LA with my friends, hang out with friends, watch movies.

speaker: Navaa
text: So would you describe yourself as, like, a current user of Canva to like, in in this moment as a student?

text: We do use Canva, we do have our premium accounts. I cannot access it, to be honest. speaker: Navaa
text: Yeah, that is kind of like a nice segue into the next question, which is, like, what's the biggest value that you would say Canva provides for you currently? And like, why do you use it? Why would you choose Canva for like, something specifically over like, Google Slides?

speaker: Jane
text: Personally, I wouldn't choose it over Google Slides. I just think I know how to use Google, like the Google Cloud stuff, better than I know how to use other, secondary party stuff like Canva. speaker: Navaa
text: Yeah, absolutely like aesthetic value. Yeah, yeah. And then what are some reasons that you would like stop using Canva and have you switched to another design tool before? And if yes, which one and why it's just like stuff you don't like about it?

text: Actually, today, I was having a hard time trying to add a text box to Canva. So I think that's kind of confusing.
